Authors: Sukmaningsih D.W., Wandoko W., Panggati I.E.
Title: Gamification effect between generation x and millennials: Study on e-commerce site
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sukmaningsih, D.W., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wandoko, W., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Panggati, I.E., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Gamification refers to technologies that aim to motivate users with incentives towards various behaviors, usually through the use of game elements. This research examines gamification in Shoppee, one of the biggest e-commerce sites in Indonesia. Based on survey data, this study examines the effect of gamification on different generations (generation X versus Millennials). The study uses a quantitative approach using SEM (Structure Equation Model) with Smart PLS to analyze the data. The result shows that there is a significantly different effect on both generations. Generation X show that perceived usefulness and recognition are an essential aspect of gamification. While for millennials, they show that playfulness and social influence are important factors. © 2020 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Electronic commerce; Information management; Different effects; E-commerce sites; Game elements; Perceived usefulness; Quantitative approach; Social influence; Structure equation models; Survey data; Gamification

Authors: Wandoko W., Panggati I.E., Sukmaningsih D.W.
Title: Developing e-loyalty toward Online Retailer from e-WOM, Reputation, Information Quality and e-trust
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wandoko, W., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Panggati, I.E., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Management Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sukmaningsih, D.W., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Customer loyalty has been an important asset for an online retailer. Previous studies stated that e-trust is an important variable in building e-loyalty. Previous studies also show that e-loyalty and e-trust are influenced by reputation, information quality, and e-WOM. The purpose of this study is to empirically investigate the impacts of information quality, reputation, e-WOM on e-trust, and e-loyalty in Indonesian online retailer context. Data were collected to test the model from the millennial generation in the Indonesian as respondents, and empirical analyses were performed using SEM PLS. The results showed that e-trust is an important factor on e-loyalty, information quality has an impact on e-trust and e-loyalty, reputation also has impact on e-trust, and e-loyalty, information quality have a significant impact on e-trust and e-loyalty, and e-WOM only have a significant impact on e-loyalty. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: E-loyalty; E-trust; E-WOM; Information quality; Online retail; Reputation
Index Keywords: Electronic commerce; Information management; Sales; Customer loyalty; E trusts; E-loyalty; Empirical analysis; In-buildings; Information quality; Information analysis

Authors: Wandoko W., Panggati I.E., Wardani L.M.I.
Title: Building millennial digital customers eloyalty toward online retailer
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Psychology Department, Mercu Buana University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wandoko, W., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Panggati, I.E., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Wardani, L.M.I., Psychology Department, Mercu Buana University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This study investigates the antecedents of millennial digital customers e-loyalty on online retailer in Indonesia context. This study proposes and examine e-trust, retailer quality, information quality, and coupon proneness as antecedent variable that potentially impact e-loyalty. This study proposes the role of coupon proneness in e-trust and e-loyalty as novelty. Data collected from 423 respondents of millennial digital costumers in Indonesia. The data collected through questionnaire. The data demonstrate that information quality and coupon proneness have impact on e-loyalty. The data also reveals that retailer quality and coupon proneness have impact on e-trust. This study contributed to the costumer trust theory and customer loyalty theory in e-commerce. Academic and managerial implications are further discussed. © 2005 - ongoing JATIT & LLS.
Author Keywords: Coupon Proneness; e-Loyalty; e-Trust; Information Quality; Retailer Quality

Authors: Panggati I.E., Wandoko W., Sasmoko, Simatupang B., Abdinagoro S.B.
Title: Factors affecting consumers attitudes towards a brand that uses digital advertising
Source title: International Journal of Advanced Trends in Computer Science and Engineering
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Binus Business School, Hang Lekir I No. 6, Senayan, Jakarta, 10270, Indonesia; Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, K. H. Syahdan No.9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Bina Nusantara University, Faculties of Humanity, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Kebun Jeruk, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Panggati, I.E., Bina Nusantara University, Binus Business School, Hang Lekir I No. 6, Senayan, Jakarta, 10270, Indonesia; Wandoko, W., Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, K. H. Syahdan No.9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sasmoko, Bina Nusantara University, Faculties of Humanity, Jl. K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Simatupang, B., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Kebun Jeruk, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia; Abdinagoro, S.B., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Kebun Jeruk, Jakarta, 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: This research focus is to analyze digital consumers millennial in Indonesia attitude toward a brand that uses digital advertising in Indonesia or a brand attitude. This research proposes three antecedent’s variable that are entertainment, personalization, and trust to the digital influencer. The analysis was based on online questionnaires with 430 data respondents. Data in this research was analyzed using SEM Lisrel. The analysis result indicates that a brand attitude has a positive and significant effect on purchase intention, entertainment doesn't have an impact on a brand attitude, while trust to digital influencer and personalization have an impact on a brand attitude, and trust to digital influencer doesn’t have an impact on purchase intention. © 2019, World Academy of Research in Science and Engineering. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Brand attitude; Digital advertising; Digital influencer; Entertainment; Personalization
